intro: Heptapleurum rudolfi, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers, which are typically followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its hairy leaves and stinging properties, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
